edu.cs495.engine.game.satcollision

Interface Collidable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SATCircle, SATPolygon

    public interface Collidable
    Classes which implement Collidable have collision logic to determine whether a collision exists and in which way
    Version:
    February 2019
    Author:
    Spencer Imbleau

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean collidesWith(Collidable object)
      Returns whether this collidable object collides with another collidable object
      CollisionEvent getCollisionEvent(Collidable object)
      Return the collision event between this object and another
      AbstractPhysicalGameObject getParent()
      Returns the parent of this collidable object
      int getXMax()
      Returns the local maximum X which should be tested for collision
      int getXMin()
      Returns the local minimum X which should be tested for collision
      int getYMax()
      Returns the local maximum Y which should be tested for collision
      int getYMin()
      Returns the local minimum Y which should be tested for collision
      void setParent(AbstractPhysicalGameObject parent)
      Set the parent of this collision

    • Method Detail

      • collidesWith

        boolean collidesWith(Collidable object)
        Returns whether this collidable object collides with another collidable object
        Parameters:
        object - - an object which is collidable
        Returns:
        true if this collides with the object, false otherwise

      • getCollisionEvent

        CollisionEvent getCollisionEvent(Collidable object)
        Return the collision event between this object and another
        Parameters:
        parent - - the object which tests collision
        object - - an object which is colliding with parent
        Returns:
        a collision event report
        See Also:
        CollisionEvent
